    public static class Convert.Any
extends Object
    Fast - all methods are implemented without any code reuse.

      • toByte

        public static final byte toByte(Object any,
                                byte defaultValue)
        Safely converts any object to byte. Following steps are performed while converting:
        • Check for NULL value - return default
        • Check for an instance of Number - return value of number
        • Check for a decimal stringual representation
        • Check for a hexadecimal representation, starting with '0x' sequence
        • Check for a boolean true/false values - return 1/0 respectively
        • Check for a boolean yes/no values - return 1/0 respectively
        • Try to parse in form '???g???m???k???' where g means multiplied by 1024 in power of 3, m means multiplied by 1024 in power of 2 and k means multiplied by 1024
        Parameters:
        any -
        defaultValue -
        Returns:
        byte

      • toChar

        public static final char toChar(Object any,
                                char def)
        Safely converts any object to char. Following steps are performed while converting:
        • Check for NULL value - return default
        • Check for an instance of Character - return value of character
        • Check for an instance of Number - return value of number
        • Check for an instance of String with a single character in it
        Parameters:
        any -
        def -
        Returns:
        char

      • toDouble

        public static final double toDouble(Object any,
                                    double defaultValue)
        Safely converts any object to double. Following steps are performed while converting:
        • Check for NULL value - return default
        • Check for an instance of Number - return value of number
        • Check for a decimal stringual representation
        • Check for a hexadecimal representation, starting with '0x' sequence
        • Check for a boolean true/false values - return 1/0 respectively
        • Check for a boolean yes/no values - return 1/0 respectively
        • Try to parse in form '???t???g???m???k???' where t means multiplied by 1024 in power of 4, g means multiplied by 1024 in power of 3, m means multiplied by 1024 in power of 2 and k means multiplied by 1024
        Parameters:
        any -
        defaultValue -
        Returns:
        float

      • toInt

        public static final int toInt(Object any,
                              int defaultValue)
        Safely converts any object to int. Following steps are performed while converting:
        • Check for NULL value - return default
        • Check for an instance of Number - return value of number
        • Check for a decimal stringual representation
        • Check for a hexadecimal representation, starting with '0x' sequence
        • Check for a boolean true/false values - return 1/0 respectively

      • toInt

        public static final int toInt(Object any,
                              String[] variants,
                              int defaultValue)
        Safely converts any object to int. Following steps are performed while converting:
        • Check for NULL value - return default
        • Check for an instance of Number - return value of number
        • Check for a case-insencetive value of one of variants passed as a parameter
        • Check for a decimal stringual representation
        • Check for a hexadecimal representation, starting with '0x' sequence
        • Check for a boolean true/false values - return 1/0 respectively
        • Check for a boolean yes/no values - return 1/0 respectively
        • Try to parse in form '???g???m???k???' where g means multiplied by 1024 in power of 3, m means multiplied by 1024 in power of 2 and k means multiplied by 1024
        Parameters:
        any -
        variants -
        defaultValue -
        Returns:
        int

      • toLong

        public static final long toLong(Object any,
                                long defaultValue)
        Safely converts any object to long. Following steps are performed while converting:
        • Check for NULL value - return default
        • Check for an instance of Number - return value of number
        • Check for an instance of Date - return value of java.util.Date
        • Check for a decimal stringual representation
        • Check for a hexadecimal representation, starting with '0x' sequence
        • Check for a boolean true/false values - return 1/0 respectively
        • Check for a boolean yes/no values - return 1/0 respectively
        • Try to parse in form '???t???g???m???k???' where t means multiplied by 1024 in power of 4, g means multiplied by 1024 in power of 3, m means multiplied by 1024 in power of 2 and k means multiplied by 1024
        Parameters:
        any -
        defaultValue -
        Returns:
        long

      • toPeriod

        public static final long toPeriod(Object any,
                                  long defaultValue)
        Safely converts any object to period in milliseconds. Following steps are performed while converting:
        • Check for NULL value - return default
        • Check for an instance of Number - return value of number
        • Check for a decimal stringual representation
        • Check for a hexadecimal representation, starting with '0x' sequence
        • Try to parse in form '???w???d???h???m???s???' where w means multiplied by weeks, d - by days, h - by hours, m - by minutes and s - by seconds
        Parameters:
        any -
        defaultValue -
        Returns:
        long

      • toShort

        public static final short toShort(Object any,
                                  short defaultValue)
        Safely converts any object to short. Following steps are performed while converting:
        • Check for NULL value - return default
        • Check for an instance of Number - return value of number
        • Check for a decimal stringual representation
        • Check for a hexadecimal representation, starting with '0x' sequence
        • Check for a boolean true/false values - return 1/0 respectively
        • Check for a boolean yes/no values - return 1/0 respectively
        • Try to parse in form '???g???m???k???' where g means multiplied by 1024 in power of 3, m means multiplied by 1024 in power of 2 and k means multiplied by 1024
        Parameters:
        any -
        defaultValue -
        Returns:
        short

      • toString

        public static final String toString(Object any,
                                    String defaultValue)
        Safely converts any object to String without any NullPointerException and null results (when defaultValue is not null). Default value returned when any is null or when any.toString() equals to null. Creates a string when source is an array.
        Parameters:
        any -
        defaultValue -
        Returns:
        string
